section.name: Demultiplexing step
section.p:
This step allow to launch demultiplexing using bcl2fastq 2. Aozan can use samplesheet in XLS format or generated by an external tool in addition of samplesheet in CSV format. Using sample sheet in XLS format allow to use alias for adapters sequences indexes.
See an example of bcl2fastq samplesheet file.

Alongside Aozan, we provide a standalone Bcl2fastq samplesheet validator available on our website that allows you to check your run samplesheet and generate a valid CSV samplesheet file. The tool is available here.
The next table contains the main parameters of this step.

tr.td: Factor to use to get the estimation of space needed in fastq directory for the run from the space used in bcl directory by the run
If it is true and no synchronization step, use direct Hiseq output for demultiplexage step
Path to a file that contains alias for adapters sequences indexes. See an example.
Adapter sequence file to use when launch bcl2fastq
Command to execute to generate the Bcl2fastq samplesheet in CSV format when bcl2fastq.samplesheet.format parameter is set to "command"
Number of mismatches allowed in adapters indexes
Add reads that not pass Illumina filter in fastq files
Number of threads to use for demultiplexing

section.h4: Configuring Bcl2fastq barcode mismatches in the samplesheet
section.p: With Aozan, you can define the number of barcode mismatches to use with Bcl2fastq by adding a entry named MismatchCount in your Settings section of the samplesheet. This value will overide of the bcl2fastq.mismatches value of the Aozan configuration file.
section.h4: Configuration to run bcl2fastq with Docker images.
section.p: This Aozan version can run Docker image for demultiplexing step. On our platform, we build a new image for each bcl2fastq version. We can downloaded from the repository genomic paris center

tr.td: Enable to use Docker container to run bcl2fastq for demultiplexing.

Full name on Docker image container to use. Example RTA version1 (software Illumina Real Time Analysis 1, it used with HiSeq sequencer). To use previous version on blc2fastq, we should call 1.8.4 Docker image name.
Full name on Docker image container to use.
